Suppose you have the following:

URI1 returns Representation1 of ResourceA
URI2 returns Representation2 of ResourceA

What allows a client to know that both URI1 and URI2 reference the same
resource (assuming it knows about both URIs)?

Can two people only claim to be talking about the same resource if they have
a URI in common for the resource?  In other words, if Person1 has only URI1
and Person2 has only URI2, can they assert that they are talking about the
same resource?

Seairth
